Content:: Mohamed Hanifa Mohamed Navavi (born 3 August 1946) is a Sri Lankan politician and Member of Parliament. Navavi was born on 3 August 1946.[1] Navavi was one of the United National Front for Good Governance's (UNFGG) candidates in Puttalam District at the 2015 parliamentary election but failed to get elected.[2][3] However, after the election he was appointed as a UNFGG National List MP in the Sri Lankan Parliament.[4][5]  This article about a Sri Lankan politician is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
